result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Winn Belisle

records.addlTxt: Order to forfeit bond
Order to Forfeit Bond
Motion to forfeit bond

11:22 AM Cases 22CF100 and 22CF07 called together.  Defendant Jason Winn Belisle in court, in custody.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Connor Hanson, PD Intern in Court overseen by Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Jason Winn Belisle.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Plea questionnaire filed by Mr. Hanson.  Agreement is recited by Mr. Hanson. Agreement is plead to Poss of THC 2nd/subsequent in 22CF100; 22CF07 will be DRI.  Both sides will argue for 2 yr. probation and a w/h sentence, court costs, AODA treatment.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  Count Possession of THC (2nd or subsequent), in 22CF100 and orders a JOC. Remaining case is DRI. DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does makes statement to the Court. Court orders:  Probation for 2 years and 1 year imposed and stayed in County Jail.  Def must apply to Drug Court and if accepted, must successfully complete Drug Court.  Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobreity, no use/poss of illegal drug, substances or paraphernalia, no use or possession of alcohol, no entering establishments whose primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  Must contact Drug Court Coordinator to apply.  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  Must report to probation immediately.  $500 in fines/fees.  DA must do motion to forfeit $250 as previously ordered.

11:44 AM Cases 22CF7 and 22CF100 called together. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason Winn Belisle in court, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Jason Winn Belisle. PD intern Connor Hansen also appears specially on behalf of the defendant, being supervised by attorney Alysja Otten. Cases on for Waivers of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files informations.  Cases proceed to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Connor Hansen asks to set plea/sentencing, recites agreement- G plea to THC (2nd), DRI remaining; joint rec for 2 yrs probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:44 PM Cases 22CF07 and 22CF100 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason Winn Belisle appeared by video, in custody appearing from Burnett County Jail.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Jason Winn Belisle. Case 22CF100 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def on probation sanction.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
$500 cash bond to cover warrants in Burnett County cases 22CF100 and 22CF07.  Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

11:23 AM Cases 22CF7 and 22CF100 called together.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear by any means for a preliminary hearing in 22CF7 and initial appearance in 22CF100.  Court makes record.  State requests forfeiture of cash bond posted and for warrant.  Court orders warrant, $500 cash bond, only judge may quash.  Court orders previous cash bond forfeited.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 11:15 am.

01:37 PM Defendant, Jason Winn Belisle, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appearing specially- def qualifies, just not yet appointed.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Court makes record, atty Pollak comfortable proceeding for today's purposes.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea to misdemeanors.  WTLPH.  Court states bond posted remains in file, does not set one.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:17 PM Cases 22CF7 and 22TR41 called together.  Defendant Jason Winn Belisle not in court.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes def's TR matter was reset to track, will not default that ticket at this time.  Court reviews for service in CF file.  Def fails to appear by any means.  State requests warrant.  Court issues warrant, $250 cash.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
